main.name: José Valdiviezo
main.bio: Fast learner Software developer. with project experience in frontend, and backend technologies with a DevOps approach. Strong team player who collaborates effectively. Looking to develop high-quality software implementations.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

description: Depth education of the most popular web technologies and practical experience with developing useful web products Modern Javascript, React / Redux, Node.js, Redis, Data privacy, Data structures, Algorithms, MySQL / MongoDB. Desktop and mobile version of websites, MySQL performance debugging, Cache from scratch, Authentication service, Background jobs system, Student dashboard in React, CRM dashboard in React
Holberton School is a computer science and software academy with an intensive program, project-based and peer learning enviroment.

work.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
descriptions: Development and maintenance web application, Cloud operator/administrator, Full stack software engineer.

check.title: Where in the world ?
check.description: This is a friendly responsive website that allows you find information about any country in the world. This project was developed with Html, Sass, JS

check.title: Space Tourism
check.description: This page web was a fronted mentor challenger for practice html, css(sass) and JS. Show information about Nasa astronaunt, some planets, some launch vehicles. It's responsive design in the mayor of movil devices.

check.title: Rock Papper and Scissors
check.description: This web page emulate the rock papper and scissors game. Has two mode: classic -> rock, papper, and scissors and bonus -> rock, papper, scissors, lizard and spock. Was make with React, sass.

check.title: Weather Web
check.description: Here you can see the weather, and news of your city, was develop in associed with Erick Peña

check.title: Simple Shell
check.description: This project is carried out in order to test all the knowledge obtained throughout the program, we must make our own command reader (Shell) and understand in depth all the processes that are executed when an order is given to the terminal .
